intro: Exacum trinervium, commonly known as the three-veined morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its delicate, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of blue or violet. The plant has slender, climbing stems and heart-shaped leaves with three prominent veins, giving it its scientific name. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sunlight. Exacum trinervium is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine in some cultures.
